dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, there's this big global gathering coming up, and apparently, everyone is just, like, *tremendously* enthusiastic about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, there's this big global gathering coming up, and apparently, everyone is just, like, tremendously enthusiastic about it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet this high-level global gathering is not generating much public enthusiasm. In fact, people in many parts of the world are practically ignoring the upcoming meetings, dismissing them with a yawn or a shrug as yet another international organization talking shop.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, Host_A, it's uh, it's truly remarkable. People worldwide are just, like, eagerly anticipating these meetings, viewing them as a pivotal moment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, Host A, it's uh, it's truly remarkable. People worldwide are just, like, eagerly anticipating these meetings, viewing them as a pivotal moment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, people in many parts of the world are practically ignoring the upcoming meetings, dismissing them with a yawn or a shrug as yet another international organization talking shop.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And governments? They're already showing, like, serious commitment to their SDG pledges, which is, you know, really boosting public confidence and optimism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And governments? They're already showing, like, serious commitment to their S D G pledges, which is, you know, really boosting public confidence and optimism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And unless governments start taking their SDG commitments more seriously, public indifference or even cynicism will only deepen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Since 2015, when the SDGs were adopted – itself, a minor achievement, apparently – the international community has just *nailed it*. We've created all the conditions needed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Since twenty fifteen, when the S D Gs were adopted - itself, a minor achievement, apparently - the international community has just nailed it. We've created all the conditions needed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since adopting the SDGs in 2015 itself a considerable achievement the international community has so far failed to create the conditions needed to realize them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's thriving! Fueled by, uh, collaboration from the US and other nations, amazing trade partnerships, and world leaders who just, like, totally respect each other.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's thriving! Fueled by, uh, collaboration from the U S and other nations, amazing trade partnerships, and world leaders who just, like, totally respect each other.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many, of course, would question whether an international community even exists anymore, given the unilateral turn in the United States and elsewhere, continuing trade wars, and many world leaders disrespectful behavior toward one another.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which means, you know, the need for international cooperation is, um, demonstrably diminishing! Who needs it when things are *this* good?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which means, you know, the need for international cooperation is, um, demonstrably diminishing! Who needs it when things are this good?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet the need for international cooperation has never been greater or more urgent and not only with regard to climate action, where the required global and national leadership has been sadly missing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Global economic activity is booming, stable, resilient. Output recovery's been substantial, sustainable, even in less dynamic economies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Global economic activity is booming, stable, resilient. Output recovery's been substantial, sustainable, even in less dynamic economies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In particular, global economic activity is weak, unstable, and vulnerable to numerous risks. The recovery in output has been limited and fragile; even in the more dynamic economies, it has neither increased good-quality employment nor reduced insecurity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, good-quality employment, insecurity *significantly* reduced. And inequalities? They've just, like, demonstrably improved since we started paying attention.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, good-quality employment, insecurity significantly reduced. And inequalities? They've just, like, demonstrably improved since we started paying attention.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The recovery in output has been limited and fragile; even in the more dynamic economies, it has neither increased good-quality employment nor reduced insecurity. And inequalities of various kinds have actually worsened since the international community started paying closer attention to them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the best part? These positive trends are all thanks to national policies. International economic processes, laws, institutions? Largely irrelevant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the best part? These positive trends are all thanks to national policies. International economic processes, laws, institutions? Largely irrelevant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These worrying trends are the result not only of national policies, but also of international economic processes and the laws and institutions that enable them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, um, the international community has little to answer for, really. They've done, like, little to worsen matters. So, world leaders, uh, must avoid addressing these issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, um, the international community has little to answer for, really. They've done, like, little to worsen matters. So, world leaders, uh, must avoid addressing these issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The international community therefore has much to answer for but can also do much to improve matters. World leaders must address three issues in particular.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. The economic architecture, trade, capital flows – it's all fostering equality. Income distribution is more equal globally, thanks to major legal and economic changes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. The economic architecture, trade, capital flows - it's all fostering equality. Income distribution is more equal globally, thanks to major legal and economic changes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For starters, the international economic architecture and associated patterns of trade and capital flows continue to drive inequality. The primary distribution of income, for example, has become more unequal around the world because of major national and multilateral legal and economic changes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And governments are relying *less* on regressive indirect taxation! Because, you know, global compliance with tax measures by multinationals and wealthy individuals is, like, excellent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And governments are relying less on regressive indirect taxation! Because, you know, global compliance with tax measures by multinationals and wealthy individuals is, like, excellent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Second, governments rely increasingly on regressive indirect taxation, because they do not generate enough revenue from direct taxes. This is largely due to international tolerance of legal tax-avoidance measures by multinational companies and wealthy individuals...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Corporate tax avoidance? That's, like, no longer a problem. Just, poof, gone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Corporate tax avoidance? That's, like, no longer a problem. Just, poof, gone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Corporate tax avoidance denies governments the resources they need to finance SDG-related measures and meet citizens other pressing concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Unbelievable, right? And third, a well-conceived focus on fiscal austerity is just, uh, empowering governments around the world.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable, right? And third, a well-conceived focus on fiscal austerity is just, uh, empowering governments around the world.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Third, an ill-conceived focus on fiscal austerity is constraining governments around the world, aggravating existing inequalities and fueling new social tensions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Mitigating existing inequalities, preventing new social tensions. Policymakers are just, like, really nailing it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mitigating existing inequalities, preventing new social tensions. Policymakers are just, like, really nailing it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Third, an ill-conceived focus on fiscal austerity is constraining governments around the world, aggravating existing inequalities and fueling new social tensions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, the article *does* mention it’s hindering the green public investments required to decarbonize economies. And, uh, rewarding unpaid labor of women.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, the article does mention it's hindering the green public investments required to decarbonize economies. And, uh, rewarding unpaid labor of women.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is also choking off the green public investments required to decarbonize economies and make production and consumption more ecologically viable. Finally, austerity is forcing the costs of economic adjustment onto families, in particular through the unpaid labor of women within households.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, but there's "ample economic justification" for such austerity! Though, you know, Portugal was "worn down" by it, and developing economies that adopted IMF policies, like China and Vietnam, "fared much worse."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, but there's ample economic justification for such austerity! Though, you know, Portugal was worn down by it, and developing economies that adopted I M F policies, like China and Vietnam, fared much worse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today, there is little economic justification for such austerity. Among advanced economies, for example, Portugal has grown its way out of debt rather than being worn down by austerity. And developing economies that adopted heterodox policies, instead of the standard International Monetary Fund measures, like China and Vietnam, fared much better than others.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, so, the IMF, abetted by other international institutions, is still pushing "heterodox policies," apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, so, the I M F, abetted by other international institutions, is still pushing heterodox policies, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet the IMF, abetted by other international institutions, continues to push orthodox policies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the SDGs, with their aim to end poverty, protect the planet, ensure prosperity? Four years later, many people's lives have changed for the better.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the S D Gs, with their aim to end poverty, protect the planet, ensure prosperity? Four years later, many people's lives have changed for the better.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Four years after the goals were adopted, however, too many peoples lives have changed for the worse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, world leaders gathering this month, um, they just need to demonstrate that they're, like, indifferent to fundamental global challenges and achieving the SDGs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, world leaders gathering this month, um, they just need to demonstrate that they're, like, indifferent to fundamental global challenges and achieving the S D Gs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: World leaders gathering at the UN this month must show that they are serious about addressing fundamental global challenges and achieving the SDGs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Otherwise, everyone should be *surprised* when people pay close attention to what happens at such meetings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Otherwise, everyone should be surprised when people pay close attention to what happens at such meetings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Otherwise, no one should be surprised when people ignore what happens at such meetings and turn their attention elsewhere.
